titlestmt.titleproper: Letters of George Washington and his contemporaries undated
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Letters of George Washington and his contemporaries
did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: Edward Ambler Armstrong (1858-1932) was a lawyer and member of the New Jersey House of Representatives (1884-1887).

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of photostats of over 100 Washington letters in the private collection of Edward Ambler Armstrong, While many of the letters deal with military affairs of the Revolutionary War, Washington's management of his estate, Mount Vernon, and that of the government during his presidency are also prevalent topics in others. Correspondents include George Clinton, Alexander Hamilton, James Madison, Robert Morris, and Bushrod Washington.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
